definition: ephemeral (idiom)
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
cloud/CL:朵[duo3]
(classical) to say
surname Yun/abbr. for Yunnan Province 雲南省|云南省[Yun2 nan2 Sheng3]

sentences.english: In the final analysis, most of life's joys are transitory.
sentences.chinese: 归根结底，尘世间的欢乐大多是过眼烟云，转瞬即逝。

sentences.english: Although many of the examples are obviously dated, their lessons are timeless.
sentences.chinese: 尽管很多往事已如过眼烟云，但他们的感悟永恒。

sentences.english: As the years flew by , so did the images.
sentences.chinese: 时光飞逝，画面也如过眼烟云。

sentences.english: The joy or sorrow, impetuous but some ephemeral.
sentences.chinese: 浮躁的欢喜或悲哀，不过是一些过眼烟云。

definition: ephemeral (idiom)
illusion (Buddhism)/pipe dream
The issue is in the past, and the situation has changed (idiom)./It is water under the bridge.
lit. a dream of Nanke/fig. dreams of grandeur
lit. chrysanthemums after the Double Ninth Festival (idiom)/fig. outdated/thing of the past/dead letter
see 黃粱夢|黄粱梦[huang2 liang2 meng4]
lit. flowers in a mirror and the moon reflected in the lake (idiom)/fig. an unrealistic rosy view/viewing things through rose-tinted spectacles/also written 水月鏡花|水月镜花
floating clouds/fleeting/transient
position and wealth (idiom); rank, fame and fortune
passing traveler/transient guest/sojourner
to dismiss sth with a laugh (idiom)/to laugh it off
lit. froth and shadows/fig. illusion/mirage
life is but a dream (idiom)
to fade into the distance/(fig.) to peter out/to fade away
to regard as unimportant/to be indifferent to (fame, wealth etc)/(of an economy or a market) to slacken
things change with the passage of time (idiom)
